1. Season 1.0 Rewards Feel Undervalued
Supporting your game and winning during the Season 1.0 where everything is raw and confusing felt like a joke because the reward system offers nothing exclusive or meaning. It also shows that devs lacks care for player efforts. I personally felt that my title is a joke with the rewards they made. 

2. Persistent Bugs With No Clear Fix Timeline
The development team is still struggling to resolve long-standing bugs, exploits, bots, multiboxers and players feel there‚Äôs no visible progress or communication. Reporting alone is a struggle where you cannot have a formal platform with ticket number and timeline to resolve issue. This creates frustration, especially when the same issues affect gameplay every day.

3. Time-Consuming Map Travel
Moving from one map to another takes around 2 minutes, which slows down gameplay, especially for players involved in large-scale fights or map-to-map content. It breaks momentum and reduces overall enjoyment.

4. No Proper Platform for Raising Issues
There‚Äôs no official place to properly report problems, ask questions, or escalate concerns. Players end up feeling ignored or forced to rely on unofficial channels. All they do is have it posted on the discord channel where no reference and timeline how long will it take to investigate or take a look into an issue. 

Reporting players in game, does not even get a confirmation or a reference number that it will be taken a look into. 

Response time of community leads takes 2 to 5 days. Personally, communication from the dev team is too vague and slow. Updates feel unclear, and players are often left guessing about how certain mechanics actually work. 

Lack of community management, this also needs a lot of improvement. No consistent presence, no clear announcements, and no transparency about problems or decisions. 

5. Poor English Translation and Communication 
Personally, I don't feel the game is friendly for English Speaking Players. Translations are confusing, inconsistent and sometimes does not match the developer's real intention. Update Notes often cause confusion and misunderstanding because of the unclear wording. 

6. Poor In-Game Rewards 
Purchasing subscription is not rewarding, even the Battle Pass and Daily Login Rewards are things you won't even use on the 2nd and 3rd Month because its very common you will definitely get more playing everyday. Progression is not rewarding in this game, and the effort-to-reward ratio is really low for the time invested. 

Overall, from my experience, the game still needs a lot of optimization. There are constant FPS Drops during large scale fights, multiple game freezes at the worst possible moments specially when clashing making you disconnect. 

Class balance is not consistent, some classes feel over-tuned while others barely feel relevant, this also applies to the equipment and potions. 

Content becomes repetitive after a while, loop feels the same and not much variety to keep long term players excited.  Events feels underdeveloped, not even an exciting reward for people to look after. Halloween Event, absolutely a failure. No initiative to keep the players engaged.

UI still feels outdated and clunky. Important information isn't shown clearly, and some features requires too much clicks to access and its buggy. Some important details are covered and can barely see and no option to customize it. 

Server Stability is very unreliable, it crashes and consumes too much memory that it needs to be restarted every now and then. Specially during the peak hours. 

Devs are interviewing people who long left the game, rather than communicating to players actively on what can make them keep playing the game. When the people who knows the current issues are the ones that kept playing. 

I feel like the game has a lot of potential, but the current directions makes it seem like the devs are overwhelmed or unsure how to move forward on this game.
